subsection_content_1: .  Up to 15,000 poultry firms have been affected by bird flu, which has cut chicken production by more than 33 percent, according to Syed Abu Siddique, president of the Bangladesh Poultry Industries Association. The number of affected farms is significantly higher than the 153 reported by the government so far. The government has exempted the industry from several taxes for the next couple of years to boost growth;  however, industry officials fear tax breaks will not be enough to revive self-sufficiency in bird and egg production without vaccines and improved control measures for bird flu.
